Summary: Engineering Analysis for TEC-415225 AJG: Payment Processing (via the UI and NOT payment app) failing since 12/30/2024
Root case issue: Starting on 12/30/2024, the AJG Processed Invoice File is failing during execution due to a System.ArgumentException. The error message specifies that "An entry with the same key already exists," which typically suggests that there is a duplicate entry in a collection or dictionary where each key must be unique. As a result of this exception, AJG is unable to process invoices, and this issue has led to missed payment processing for three consecutive runs
Preventive Steps taken: Action: Network discount cases are part of smoke test suite every release
Summary of Actions: Test Case exists. Automation not possible as invoice id needs to pass in text file each run for Fee app in VM to execute.

Summary: [Engg Analysis /TEC-419331]: Chubb Group Claims: In Vendor Review Status where Reviewer has a Supervisor
Root case issue: Not Automated
Preventive Steps taken: In the Chubb Group Claims network Affiliated Vendors submit invoices and the initial status is In Vendor Review with the Law Firm's Lead Timekeeper. After the Lead Timekeeper approves the invoice the status should go to In Review with Chubb's Responsible Professional. When the Lead Timekeeper has a Supervisor assigned, the invoice goes to the Supervisor after the Lead Timekeeper approves the invoice and the status changes to In Review. Chubb wants to ensure that invoices in review with law firm members do not have the "In Review" status.

Root case issue: Not Automated

Invoices Awaiting Review Report + Issue: Column M fast pay notation changed from "N/A" to "0". + Expected behavior: Standard pay firms should be noted as "N/A". + Attachments: Two reports - the most recent correct report showing "N/A" designation for fast pay, and the most recent incorrect report showing "0" designation for fast pay applicable. 2. Appeals Awaiting My Review Report + Issue: Column J lists all firms as fast pay. + Expected Behavior: Column J should note "No" and "Yes" to differentiate between fast pay and standard pay appeals. + Attachments: Two reports - the most recent correct report showing both "Yes" and "No" for fast pay applicable, and the most recent incorrect report showing only "Yes" for fast pay applicable. 3. Reviewer Performance Report + Issue: Column U calculated fast pay achievement as 77.9%. + Expected Behavior: Fast pay achievement is consistently 99%. + Attachment: One report - Reviewer performance report showing a decrease in the fast pay achievement percentage.
Preventive Steps taken: Actions: Fast pay objects with positive and negative scenarios included as part of regression.
Summary of Actions: Test case is written. Automation created . Pipeline is established.
Completion Status: Completed
Actions: Prioritized and released as part of 25.2.4 https://dev.azure.com/GRC-ELM/T360/_build/results?buildId=534638&view=ms.vss-test-web.build-test-results-tab
